item.title: Blog Dark Theme
item.description: How this dark theme was generated The code was automatically generated Dark Reader (in this case the safari plugin in dynamic mode). The CSS was then exported on following advice. I haven’t yet cleaned the generated CSS at all.

item.title: Design Inspiration
item.description: Design Inspiration Here is some inspiration or at least reference material to draw upon. Merchant Adyen Stripe Consumer (Banking) Revoult for clean minimal design Monzo for doing a good at calling out features Consumer Merchant Interactions Tayble for a straight forward simplistic UI Developer Focused Dsign Now.sh

item.title: Broken System Headers
item.description: Do Not Touch System Headers But if you do it’s ok Editing system headers can provide the most mind boggling errors imaginable. Especially if what you edit a macro. I reconfirmed this while playing around with the definition of the NS_ENUM macro in CoreFoundation. I deleted it, got distracted and left the header file without thinking about it any further. Then suddenly I nothing would build for me. It took me probably 15 minutes before remembering I was playing around in system headers.

item.title: State Restoration for Settings Changes
item.description: State Restoration with Custom Transition Modals When requesting permissions and the user has in the past declined your application, the best thing you can do is open to your apps settings page. However if the user changes any of the permissions your app is granted the system will kill your app. This is a smart way to help ensure permissions are more easily enforced. The issue comes when a user would expect to be able to toggle the permission on and go straight back to where they were.
